intro: Prunus mutabilis subf. rosea, commonly known as the pink-flowered cherry, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from white to pink and eventually red, changing color as the bloom progresses. The plant has small, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, dark red fruits known as drupes. It thrives in temperate climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. The species is part of the Rosaceae family and is closely related to other cherry species.
